name: Model Context Protocol
description: Open standard for connecting AI applications to external data sources, tools, and workflows. Like USB-C for AI.

name: Agent2Agent Protocol
description: Open protocol enabling AI agents on different frameworks to discover, communicate, and collaborate on complex tasks.

name: Agent Client Protocol
description: Standardizes communication between code editors (IDEs, text-editors) and coding agents that use generative AI to autonomously modify code.

name: AGENTS.md
description: Simple, open companion to README.md that gives coding agents a predictable, machine-readable place for project guidance. Adopted by 20k+ GitHub repos.

name: x402
description: Open standard for internet-native payments enabling frictionless micropayments and AI agent transactions via HTTP 402.

name: Agent Payments Protocol
description: Open protocol for the emerging Agent Economy. Enables secure, reliable, and interoperable agent commerce. Available as an extension for A2A.

name: A2A x402 Extension
description: Brings cryptocurrency payments to A2A protocol, enabling agents to monetize services through on-chain payments. Revives HTTP 402 for decentralized agent ecosystem.

name: Cross App Access
description: Identity Assertion Authorization Grant that lets enterprises enable secure agent-to-app and app-to-app access with centralized IT oversight.

name: Agent Communication Protocol
description: Open protocol for agent interoperability connecting AI agents, applications, and humans. Now part of A2A under the Linux Foundation.

name: Agent-User Interaction Protocol
description: Lightweight, event-based protocol that standardizes how AI agents connect to user-facing applications. Built for simplicity and flexibility.

name: agents.json
description: Open-source JSON specification defining machine-readable contracts for API and AI agent interactions on top of OpenAPI. Adds LLM-optimized schemas and tool directives.

name: llms.txt
description: Standardized markdown file giving LLMs concise, expert-level context and pointers to detailed docs, avoiding noisy HTML. Supports deterministic parsing.

name: Agent Commerce Kit
description: Open-source toolkit enabling AI agents to securely participate in commerce. ACK-ID for verifiable identity using W3C DIDs/VCs, ACK-Pay for standardized payments.

name: Agent Gateway Protocol
description: High-performance messaging and routing layer for agent meshes with channel-based addressing and connection tables. Emphasizes mTLS, RBAC, encryption, and observability.

name: Agent Protocol
description: REST+OpenAPI spec where every agent exposes standard endpoints like POST /ap/v1/agent/tasks. Enables registries and orchestration to interact with heterogeneous agents.

name: NANDA
description: Networked Agents and Decentralized AI. Decentralized registry model mapping agent IDs to cryptographically verifiable AgentFacts for distributed discovery and verification.

name: A2A Registry
description: Registry for A2A-compatible agents with registration, discovery, namespaces, and version management. Uses Agent Cards (JSON schemas) describing capabilities and endpoints.
